system.description:
This spell functions similarly to the Polymorph Others spell but extends its effects to objects as well as creatures. The spell transforms one target into another form, following the rules outlined below.

Target Limitations:

  • Objects: If the object is part of a larger whole (e.g., a wall section), the spell affects a volume of up to 10' × 10' × 10'.
  • Creatures: A creature may attempt a saving throw vs. spells (at a -4 penalty) to resist the effect.
  • Hit Dice Limit: A creature with more than twice the caster’s level in Hit Dice is immune (e.g., a 20th level caster cannot affect a 41+ HD creature).

Duration Based on Transformation:

  • Same Kingdom: If the transformation remains within the same kingdom (e.g., animal to animal), the effect is permanent until dispelled.
  • Adjacent Kingdom: If changing between adjacent kingdoms (e.g., animal → vegetable or vegetable → mineral), the effect lasts 1 hour per caster level ([[/r @actor.details.level*360 #Duration in rounds]]).
  • Distant Kingdom: If changing between distant kingdoms (e.g., animal → mineral), the effect lasts 1 turn per caster level ([[/r @actor.details.level*60 #Duration in rounds]]).

Additional Rules & Notes:

  • Newly created creatures are not automatically friendly to the caster.
  • Polymorph does not affect age or hit points—these remain unchanged.
  • The spell can be reversed via a Dispel Magic spell (normal chances of success apply).
  • For additional polymorphing rules, refer to Polymorph Self and Polymorph Others.
system.effect: Changes form of one object or creature
